newsitem.title: POLAND: IB Austria rates Polifarb C long-term buy.
newsitem.headline: IB Austria rates Polifarb C long-term buy.

text.p: Investors should buy shares of Polish paintmaker Polifarb Cieszyn in the long term, with the firm buoyed by its planned merger with Polifarb Wroclaw, Investmentbank Austria said in a report.

"The merger will dramatically improve the new company's market position and significantly increase its profitability ....Therefore, we recommend Polifarb Cieszyn as a long-term buy," the report dated January 29 said.
The two firms plan to merge at mid-year.

Under the plan Cieszyn would raise its share capital by 2,978,820 shares to equal Wroclaw's 22,103,820 shares. Later Cieszyn would set another issue for Wroclaw shareholders and a one-for-one share exchange would take place.
IB Austria said cost-cutting and rationalisation from the merger would make a substantial impact in 1998 and 1999.

For valuation purposes IB Austria used the January 29 18.9-zloty price of Polifarb Cieszyn with the assumption that its existing shareholders would receive two free shares for each 13 existing. The stock closed on Friday at 19.8 zlotys.
IB Austria predicted Polifarb Cieszyn would raise net profit to 19 million zlotys in 1996, 37 million in 1997 and 65 million in 1998 from 15 million zlotys in 1995.
Net sales would rise to 306 million zlotys in 1996, 492 million in 1997 and 710 million in 1998 from 261 million zlotys in 1995.
According to preliminary figures Cieszyn made a net profit of 19.1 million zlotys last year on sales of 306.5 million.
IB Austria saw Cieszyn's price-earnings ratio falling to 18.9 in 1996, 17.2 in 1997 and 12.9 in 1998 from 23.6 in 1995. @

It said that based on 1996 earnings the firm's shares traded at a premium of 32 percent to its international competitors. "This year's earnings forecasts, however, yield a premium of 16 percent and 1998 forecasts result in a six-percent disount in terms of PER," the report said.
